column4: guys i figured out my problem now,   i install the fglrx package via synaptic but the kernel doesnt load the module
if the package installs correctly how can i instruct the kernel to load the module at bootup?
i got a ATI 9250
i think that the ATI driver dont support my 9250 otherwise id be done already
anyone got experience with FGLRX out there?  specifically the ubuntu package?
yeah me2     james im on day 7 now
james: have you guys read this page? https://wiki.ubuntu.com/BinaryDriverHowto
heres my response to that                          homeslice@ubuntu:~$ sudo depmod -a ; sudo modprobe fglrx
rebooting won't help
im getting the same fatal error after a reboot
ok
stand by...

i had the fglrx drivers working when i installed them from the ATI site, but they dont support my 9250 card... *im pretty sure*,         the ubuntu package installed drivers in a couple completely different places than the ATI package did
is the 9250 a very recent card?
ah, ok
standby again (sorry ;)

thats why im just gonna focus on the ubuntu registered program and not mess around with the ati packages anymore,     sure take your time     ive been tryin this for about 4 days straight now i can wait a lil while
the ubuntu package installed about 10 files in /usr/X11R6, the ati packages didnt install anything there?
what's the output of 'dpkg -l xorg-driver-fglrx| tail -1'   ?
hmm
hmm
ok, let me go find where that file is
before i unloaded the ATI version fglrx, there would be a successful modprobe
did you install the ubuntu version before or after uninstalling the ati version?
ah
i think i know what might have happened
the fglrx.ko file is in the linux-restricted-modules package
the ATI version overwrote that, and then erased it when uninstalled
you just need to reinstall linux-restricted-moudles
didnt think of that,   ill use apt-get and specify my kernel version right?
yeah
you know how to do this?
yip
i think there's a --reinstall flag -- check the --help or 'man apt-get'
ok that reinstalled correctly from the CD
ok, try the 'depmod -a; modprobe fglrx' thing now
uh oh
homeslice@ubuntu:~$ depmod -a; modprobe fglrx
remember not to paste too much here
i know    if it would have been another line or 2 i woulda used pastebin
whaddya think about that error?
as OdiiN said, you need sudo for both of those
ok didnt see that
nothing
um
should i reboot then try those commands?
this is new on me
well then we're both learning hehe
the depmod -a worked ?
yes
i can't tell why that module does not load; rebooting is an option
im gonna reboot then try those commands again as per described on the wiki                     ill brb
if fglrx is still in /etc/modules, it *should* load on boot
its there   ill brb
its actually listed there 4 seperate times hehe    does that matter?
only once is fine
modprobe didnt load any errors
cool
now you just need to tweak /etc/X11/xorg.conf
you need to change 'ati' to 'fglrx'
im gonna do that right now,  modprobe and depmod both ran smoothly
you should not need to run those again, especially if fglrx is listed in /etc/modules

ok      well kern.log says it loaded, modprobe says its loaded, ubuntu says its the correct version and has been verified to work on my radeon 9250, all i gotta do is restart now, wish me luck ill be back in 2 minutes
also, you don't need to reboot again. let me know when you've tweaked xorg
woah ;)
have you tweaked xorg.conf ?
yes    im gonna shut down gdm and restart it
ok
brb
didnt work, it hung like usual
hmm
hmmm is right    wtf   =(   i had my hopes up there
sorry. have you looked in /var/log/Xorg.0.log  ?
it hangs before it gets to write to the log, ive tried like 5 different ways to get to read that but it doesnt get to write to it
i think im just about out of ideas    i just cant see whats going wrong?
i'm out of ideas too, sorry.
can u think of anywhere else i can get advice?
ubuntuforums, and the mailing lists
i tried ubuntuforums like 3 times but noone there helped
ok, the mailing list. standby
ok   i dont know what that is so ill wait for ya here   just lemme know
finding the mailing list address
ok  im gonna register at linuxquestions.org and try there too
look here: http://www.ubuntulinux.org/community/lists  or look at Seveas' URL
ok thanks again
ya think i can get this fglrx nonsense working if i recompile a kernel following this: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/KernelHowto
i don't know, sorry
ok ill give it a shot i have nuttin to lose
do you have a reason to think it will help?
no   none at all
you can try, but i wouldn't be too optimistic
ok
